title: Massachusetts emergency room wait times rank among the longest in the U.S.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts ranks third in the U.S. for longest emergency room wait times, averaging 189 minutes.
ER wait times increase due to hospital overcrowding, staffing shortages, and capacity issues, according to health analyses.
Behavioral health visits contribute significantly to extended ER stays, with 39% of visits in 2024 related to mental health.

title: Report: Retired 5x Pro Bowl left-tackle offers to help train Will Campbell
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Terron Armstead offered to train Patriots LT Will Campbell in Dallas after his Super Bowl struggles.
Campbell faced criticism for his technique, not arm length, after a poor Super Bowl performance.
Armstead, a five-time Pro Bowler, believes Campbell's issues are fixable with improved power and timing.

title: More than 400 readers voted: $240K in-office Boston job or $120K remote?
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: 56% of 400 Boston.com readers favor a $240K in-office job over a $120K remote position.
Many favoring $120K remote jobs prioritized flexibility, time savings, and avoiding long commutes.
Higher salary proponents cited financial benefits and preference for in-office social interactions.

title: City councilor calls for restrictions on e-bikes and mopeds, including ban for food delivery drivers
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Councilor Ed Flynn proposes restricting e-bikes and mopeds in Boston, citing public safety and health concerns.
Flynn's proposal includes banning high-speed e-bikes from bike lanes and requiring registration and licensing for certain vehicles.
DoorDash warns the proposed ban on delivery vehicles could harm local businesses and worker income, while increasing car congestion.

title: Video shows corrections officers brawling in elevator at Boston jail
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Three correctional officers were involved in a fight inside an elevator at Suffolk County House of Correction Saturday morning.
The incident, captured on video, began when a cup of coffee was knocked out of an officer's hand, escalating into a brawl.
The Suffolk County Sheriff’s Department is investigating and stated appropriate disciplinary actions will follow the investigation's results.

title: Asparagus could soon become Massachusetts’ official state vegetable
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Bill proposes asparagus as Massachusetts' official state vegetable to honor its history in Hadley and Hampshire County.
State Rep. Homar Gomez and Sen. Jo Comerford filed the bill, inspired by Hadley Elementary School students.
Asparagus once made up 80% of the nation's supply, but now covers 215 acres across Massachusetts.

title: Paula Cole wants to spend Valentine’s Day with you
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Paula Cole is set to perform a Valentine's Day concert at Groton Hill Music Center in Groton.
Cole announces 'This Fire: 30' tour with a Boston stop on September 18 at The Wilbur.
Her 'Sonic Memoir' archival set, featuring 64 tracks, will release alongside the tour celebrating 'This Fire'.

title: Boston meteorologists say Monday’s storm is ‘trending toward a miss’
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists report Monday's storm likely to miss Boston, trending farther south and east offshore.
Local forecasts predict mainly dry and quiet weather into the holiday weekend, with minor snow showers possible.
Temperatures are expected to become milder next week, with highs reaching the 40s.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 12, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Citrus & Salt opens a second location in Burlington, offering Mexican-inspired cuisine with a patio and private dining, summer 2026.
Moro Mou by Xenia Hospitality launches in Seaport, blending Greek and Japanese cuisines with a 15-seat omakase, opening summer 2026.
The Down Low begins offering cocktails and live entertainment in Woburn, providing a supper club environment with Detroit-style pizza.

title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic led the Celtics with 19 points and 11 rebounds off the bench in a 124-105 win over the Bulls.
Payton Pritchard scored 26 points, efficiently managing the game as the Celtics secured a blowout victory before the All-Star break.
Jordan Walsh contributed defensively with three steals and two blocks, adding 16 points and six rebounds against the Bulls.
